content: festival water bottle carrier a few years ago i was on my way to the local scottish festival with a water bottle for the day but no carrier for it i brought yarn and a hook and finished it while in line since then i ve made many more for k ids teachers and friends this pattern relies on a thicker fabric for more i nsulation from the heat of the day it also safely holds c ash and cards at the bottom if you re trying to consolidate your carryings while out and about materials - 1 1 2 skeins nature s choice organic 100% organic cotton worsted 94 yds - h-8 5 00mm hook - tapestry needle gauge is not critical but make sure the base width matches the bottle width sizes s m l s = short 12 oz bottle m = 12-18 oz bottle l = 27 oz bottle base using magic loop method single_crochet 6 sts join in the round with slip_stitch round 1 chain 1 *2 single_crochet in next st repeat from * to end slip_stitch to join 12 st round 2 chain 1 *single_crochet 2 single_crochet into next st repeat from * to end slip_stitch to join 18 st round 3 chain 1 *single_crochet 2 single_crochet into next st single_crochet repeat from * to end slip_stitch to join 24 st round 4 chain 1 *single_crochet in next 3 sts 2 single_crochet into next st repeat from * to end slip_stitch to join 30 st round 5 l only chain 1 single_crochet in next 2 sts *2 single_crochet into next st single_crochet into next 4 sts repeat from * to 4 sts from end 2 single_crochet into next st single_crochet into next 2 sts slip_stitch to join 36 st body stitch counts will remain the same as your last base round rounds 1-4 chain 1 single_crochet in each st around slip_stitch to join round 5 chain 3 *skip 1 double_crochet in next st double_crochet in skipped stitch repeat from * to end slip_stitch to join round 6 chain 4 treble_crochet in each st around slip_stitch to join size s repeat round 5 size m repeat rnds 5 and 6 twice repeat round 5 size l repeat rnds 5 and 6 three times repeat round 5 © rachael lauritzen 2018 rim rounds 1-2 chain 1 single_crochet in each st around slip_stitch to join strap round 1 chain 1 single_crochet in next 3 sts size s repeat round 1 until strap measures 28 or desired length size m repeat round 1 until strap measures 30 or desired length size l repeat round 1 until strap measures 32 or desired length join strap lay body flat with beg of strap in back on fold being careful not to twist pull strap in front to opposite fold and tuck working end up to match the 3 sts closest to fold making sure that live loop is on the right add or pull out 1 row as needed slip_stitch
